results.title: A Family of Tokyo
results.brief_description: A working day and a holiday in the life of a Japanese middle-class family of a husband, wife and three school-age children. Shows the respective status, roles and functions of family members and the ble.ding of the traditional and modern in family life

results.title: A Family group
results.creator_credit: FilmFair, Ivor Wood and Michael Bond
results.brief_description:
Animated children’s story about Paddington Bear and his adventures. In this chapter Paddington goes out and buys a camera so that he can take a photograph of the family.
Adapted from Chapter 1 from the book: More about paddington. Narrated by Michael Hordern.

results.title: A Family affair: conflict
results.creator_credit: Mental Health Film Board and Irving Jacoby
results.brief_description: An 18 year-old boy leaves home against his parents’ wishes to work in a summer theatre. This aggravates the tense family atmosphere which results from an over-anxious and over-possessive mother and a father who is frustrated and withdrawn into himself. They both agree to seek help from a social case-worker who helps them to continue marriage as responsible adults. When the teenage daughter wishes to go out with someone of whom mother does not approve, father is able to persuade mother that the girl should be allowed to make her own mistakes.

results.title: A Family affair
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit, Helen De Mourpied and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: A plea for foster-parents to take in orphaned, neglected or deserted children. Shows conditions in a special home; points out some of the personal difficulties faced by such children; maintains that only a place in a real family will allow these children a full and free life; examples of a husband and wife who took in six children of various ages at the one time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Crown Film Unit, Helen De Mourpied and Margaret Thomson

results.title: A Fair go in life
results.brief_description: Looks at the operation of the Supplementary Grants Program at Springvale Primary School, a disadvantage school. Notes in particular the process involved in opening the lines of communication between the school and the community.

results.title: A Fair cop
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria, Seon Film Productions, Steven Salgo, John Cruthers and Craig Kirchner
results.brief_description: A film, for young people to see, that emphasises road safety for cyclists. The film is a fictional dramatisation of a policeman on patrol who encounters some careless riders.

results.title: A Failure to communicate
results.creator_credit: Video Education Australasia, Neil Barrett and Justin Shortal
results.brief_description: Focuses on the importance of interactive talk in learning and looks at five different communication situations, each of which is shown in two different versions involving students and teachers.

results.title: A Fable for friendship
results.creator_credit: Czechoslovak State Film, Unesco and Jiri Trnka
results.brief_description: Animated fable to show what can be achieved by the exchange of ideas and skills between peoples. Explains that the Y shape of the new UNESCO headquarters building is a symbol of the meeting place where peoples of 100 nations come together to benefit from what each has learned in the field of education, science and culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Czechoslovak State Film, Unesco and Jiri Trnka

results.title: A Fable by Aesop: The North wind and the sun (K)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall, Les Drew and Rhoda Leyer
results.brief_description: An engaging illustration, by animation artist Rhoda Leyer, of the ancient Greek fable in which the warm sun proves to the cold wind that persuasion is better than force when it comes to making a man take off his overcoat. Music by Karl Duplessis.
